resources.string: Select a server to download apk files.
Enable this if patched apps does not work after a while.
Enable this if you cannot uninstall official apps.
Remove temporary files from the cache.
Is it safe to use? Read safety note.
Visit help forum and ask your question.
WARNING: Fallback mode is enabled. If you didn\'t enable it, please disable from the settings tab.

Instructions: 

Uninstall all official facebook apps: facebook, messenger, facebook lite, etc. 

Install ChatHeadEnabler module. 

Patch and install messenger apps from here. 

Watch video tutorial (from app menu) for full instruction. 

[Visit help forum from the settings tab]

Troubleshoot: 

Download failed? 
Select different servers from settings or try again later. 
Alternatively you can download messenger from apkmirror.com and patch it using manual option. 

Not working? 
Make sure you installed ChatHeadEnabler. Also try restarting Messenger app. 

Not working after few days? 
Enable fallback mode from settings and patch again. 

[Visit help forum from the settings tab]

Safety Note: 

Is it safe to use? 
Yes. It is safe, just like any other app installed from the playstore. 
[Make sure you installed the MRVPatch Manager from the official github link] 

How can I be sure it is safe? 
All the apps used here are open source, you can find source codes at github. 

What safety measures are taken? 
The manager downloads your selected app from the apk servers and verifies it against the original facebook signature, which makes sure you are patching an official facebook app from the playstore.
